hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Catalyst Decay & Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (confidence 55-70%), the initial price amplification from a news catalyst (like Binance APR or options expiry) will fully mean-revert within 36 hours, creating a high-probability fade opportunity at the peak of the 1h RSI.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound price action and lack of sustained directional conviction. News catalysts create sharp, sentiment-driven moves that exhaust quickly due to the absence of underlying trend momentum, leading to a high probability of retracement as opportunistic sellers emerge.
entry_conditions: A clear news catalyst (identified by >5 news headlines) causes a >3% move in the asset within 2 hours
1h RSI(14) of the asset crosses above 75 during the move
4h chart shows the asset is not in a clear structural uptrend (e.g., price below 20-period MA on 4h)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial catalyst-driven move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new high beyond the catalyst peak

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If, in a NEUTRAL regime, more than 40% of qualifying catalyst moves (>3%, RSI>75) continue to trend in the same direction for >36 hours without a 50% retracement.
